website_summaries.verdict: The Mt Adams, a backpacking boot from Danner, undoubtedly excelled in providing comfort and traction on the trails. However, its unsatisfactory points are not to be set aside. Its flimsy laces and imprecise width caused disappoinments. On the whole, the Danner Mt Adams still earned enough reasons for interested buyers to check it out. It may not be the best for wide-footed individuals though.
pros: Some satisfied owners of the Mt Adams from Danner testified to its right-out-of-the-box comfort
This backpacking boot offered a right amount of ankle support, based on several consumer reviews
A handful of users said that the Mt Adams required little-to-no breaking in
The grippy tread of the outsole received appreciation from a good deal of hikers
A small number of backpackers noted that it protected their foot from getting wet
cons: A significant percentage of wearers were dismayed when the laces of the Danner Mt Adams were damaged after merely a few weeks of use
A majority of online purchasers expressed how frustrated they were with its narrow toe box

customer_reviews.title: but overall I'm very happy with them
customer_reviews.text: They took a while to break in, and I had to buy after market arch supports, but overall I'm very happy with them. They are very well made and so far appear very durable. I hike 3 miles a day up a steep, rocky trail to the top of the Santa Monica Mtns, and have done several long hikes in the late snow Sierras with no cold or wetness, so I think all round they deserve 5 stars. The laces are pretty rubbish though, so I had to replace them after 3 months or around 350 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Macpherson

customer_reviews.title: Like the shoes hate the glue wish it was a Goodyear welt
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are comfortable and leather looks good...some of the glue at the toe seems to be coming off...but I haven't tested the boots to see if it has effected the waterproofness or if its just cosmetics...hopefully cosmetically only....I'd order a half size larger for an extra eighth inch of room to allow your feet to swell or thicker socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Consistent sizing so once you know your size no more guessing.
customer_reviews.text: Very good fit, comfortable, waterproof. The extra hook for laces gives much more support than the shorter model.
customer_reviews.author: Ken F.

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like these boots but in the end they just were ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these boots but in the end they just were too uncomfortable. I could not imagine hiking long distances in them. As an earlier review states the back of the boot pinches right on the tendon. I gave them a week to break in but it just was not worth the pain. Only positive is that they seem to be extremely durable. On to Salomons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Narrow toe.
customer_reviews.text: Super narrow toe. I'm surprised they make a shoe like that.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: It seems the boot neck falls right on the tendon in my leg in a bad spot. Try them on and if they feel ...
customer_reviews.text: Warning: Outstanding, quality made boot but you have to try them on. I bought a pair online without trying on (no one carries Danner around here) and by the way the boot is made, the neck applies pressure right on my Achilles tendon (below) the calf muscle. I literally cannot wear this boot longer than about 1/2 hour until the pressure is just too much and it hurts the whole calf area. It seems the boot neck falls right on the tendon in my leg in a bad spot. Try them on and if they feel right, you will be happy. It is an excellent boot.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, great in theory, but frankly they suck. Too small in the toe area. It feels like my feet a crammed in a smaller sized boot. I am returning these boots for something different. I really like Danner boots but these are a failure in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great boot
customer_reviews.text: great boot. seems to be well made. stood in water for about an hour fishing and feet were completely dry. warm, very comfortable and fit great. i would recommend these danners. plus they're american made!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, we’ll see if they last two years. Lol
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these boots for over a year now. Bought a different pair at the same time hoping to make them last longer by not wearing the same pair every day. Never put any oil or anything on them and they are still holding together. The left boot string did get damaged somehow but the inside part of the string is still holding. Only aggravation I have is now trying to find an insole replacement. I work as a low voltage electrical technician which puts me on concrete and climbing ladders 99% of the time I’m not driving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built comfort
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got my boots I treated them with protectant and replaced the laces with 550 cord. The laces they come with seem a bit thin and delicate. The boots are very comfortable wearing first time out of the box. I wore them all day walking around and they are a pleasure in my feet. They fit true to size and seem very well mad. The tread seem to have very good grip as well. Can't wait to putting them to work in the Adirondack mountains.
customer_reviews.author: S. Norton

customer_reviews.title: its a weird danner boot
customer_reviews.text: the shoe is narrow, the shoe is so stiff, break in will take months, boot does not flex. i wanted to like this boot. waited 3 months before pulling the trigger to buy. the boot looks good but I feel like the other reviews. not worth the money for the stiff feel, no comfort.
customer_reviews.author: mickey mouse

customer_reviews.title: Used all over the country/world
customer_reviews.text: Have used everywhere from the White Mountains, 14ers in Colorado, to Haiti. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Danner Mt Adams 4.5" Brown
product_meta.description: Durable full-grain leather and nylon upper. Abrasion-resistant toe cap. 100% waterproof and breathable GORE-TEX lining. Cushioning fatigue fighter footbed. Polyurethane midsole for durable shock absorption. Danner mt. Adams outsole for traction over varied terrain. Made in the USA with imported components
